section.title: Workflow Activities
section.para: Workflow Activities are generated from workflow configuration steps based on the trigger actions occurring. You can navigate to the Workflow Activities screen via System > Workflow Activities. This is a list of activities where you can filter by user in order to see what that user has to do. It brings together everything that the worker is scheduled to do right now. Other filters include module, status, assigned to, and owner. Double-clicking the line will take you straight to the screen that you need to do the task.

By right-clicking the workflow activity, you are able to receive or post the receipt, edit the activity, or delete the activity. The Workflow Activity screen is very similar to the Workflow Step screen.
Below are the fields you will see on the Workflow Activity screen:

listitem.para: The module for the workflow. This field can not be modified in this screen.
Type is for each module. This field can not be modified in this screen.
Standard actions are used to drive the activity list and open up screens automatically. This field can not be modified in this screen.
A brief statement summarizing the purpose of the workflow.
The system will send notifications to these people.
The system will send notifications to these people.
This is the profile that is attached to the workflow step.
Identifies the current state of the workflow.
Dates are used to define when a subsequent step must begin.
Dates are used to define when a subsequent step must be completed.
Date the activity should take place.
An open text field for additional notes relating to the workflow

section.para: You are able to view the next steps for the workflow once it is complete and has passed or finished any requirements.

listitem.para: The next steps once the workflow is completed.

section.para: You are able to view the next steps for the workflow once it has been determined that it has failed or has not successfully been completed.

listitem.para: The next steps once the workflow is deferred.
